definition: Primary join key used in other files (format D-001).
notes: Minor formatting issues may appear in project_history.csv.

definition: Share of population living in urban areas.
Proxy for access to health services (higher is better).
Proxy for mobile access (higher is better).
Proxy for reliability of electricity supply.
Number of prior resilience programs recorded (synthetic).
Relative flood hazard intensity index (higher = worse).
notes: Seasonal; mild upward trend in flood-prone districts.

definition: Relative heat hazard intensity index (higher = worse).
Standardized rainfall anomaly for the month (higher = wetter).
Standardized temperature anomaly for the month (higher = hotter).
Number of flood events recorded this month (synthetic).
Number of heatwave days recorded this month (synthetic).
Primary hazard focus for the intervention.
Typical unit cost for one district-scale deployment.
Expected mean fractional reduction in risk.
Low bound on expected fractional reduction.
High bound on expected fractional reduction.
Typical duration to implement in a district.
Most common prerequisite or gating requirement.
District code where the project was implemented.
Planned end date based on typical duration.
Baseline district risk score used for internal planning (synthetic).
Overall outcome score based on internal rubric (synthetic).
Post-hoc audit score (available only after completion).
notes: Leakage risk: do not use as predictor.
Leakage risk: do not use as predictor.

definition: Each note includes date, country/region, district id and code, partner, intervention.
Operational severity recorded by field team (higher = more severe).
Approximate schedule impact referenced in the note.
Suggested mitigation steps linked to the primary risk category.
Some notes include an explicit line indicating worsening heatwaves/rainfall disruptions.
File and matching hint to locate evidence.
Field note filename where snippet appears.
Single risk label from the taxonomy (optional stretch).
